description: Music 267 is a studio course focusing on advanced techniques of acting and singing for the
musical stage with emphasis on opera. Students explore voice, movement, improvisation and
characterization at an advanced level. They receive coaching in musical and dramatic style
through solo and small ensemble literature and prepare scenes for class performance. May be
repeated once. Prerequisites: Two semester of voice study and Theatre 131 (Acting for the Lyric
fullname: Advanced Acting For The Lyric Stage
